alert.note: Alert for Apache Junction, Gold Canyon; East Valley; Fountain Hills, East Mesa; Northwest Pinal County; Scottsdale, Paradise Valley; Southeast Valley, Queen Creek; Superior (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 5:34PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...Thunderstorm winds and potentially additional thunderstorms will impact portions of Maricopa and Pinal Counties through 615 PM MST... At 532 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorm winds along a line extending from Fountain Hills to 12 miles south of Boyce Thompson Arboretum. Movement was southwest at 20 mph. Blowing dust possible. Additional storm redevelopment possible. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Mesa, Scottsdale, Gilbert, Apache Junction, Florence, Fountain Hills, Paradise Valley, Gold Canyon, East Mesa, Queen Creek, Granite Reef Dam, Gold Camp, Falcon Field Airport, Salt River Indian Community, Usery Mountain Park, San Tan Village Mall, San Tan Valley, Freestone Park, Florence Junction and Downtown Scottsdale. This includes the following highways... US Highway 60 between mile markers 180 and 215. AZ Route 87 between mile markers 172 and 193. AZ Route 202 between mile markers 11 and 41. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Apache Junction, Gold Canyon; East Valley; Fountain Hills, East Mesa; Northwest Pinal County; Scottsdale, Paradise Valley; Southeast Valley, Queen Creek; Superior
